title.narrative: Independent Journalism Center - Educating Young Journalists: media coverage for a better informed audience

description.narrative: A longer-term training program is needed to impact the quality of journalism practices in the Republic of Moldova. The concept of the Chisinau School of Advanced Journalism follows the experience of other successful schools of journalism teaching practical journalism in the conditions close to a real life newsroom. This way the young journalists will be ready to enter the work force able to practice quality journalism and inform the audiences in a professional manner. Ten-month-long courses for 15 to 20 asp iring journalists from Moldova are organized aiming at preparing the ?universal? journalist who is able to adapt in the modern media environment and ready for the challenges of the profession by knowing and practicing all aspects of their profession.The ob jectives of having the Chisinau School of Advanced Journalism at the Journalism Center are two-fold: As media remains a major source of information for the population in Moldova a better informed public can be achieved through having professional journalis ts informing the readers and viewers in Moldova. Also as a result of the School of Journalism activity in previous years IJC sees the graduating journalists producing noticeably better journalism products. IJC is following the career paths of these graduat es and it sees that they are hired by the media gladly and are also more active professionally coming up with new projects and ideas. Having such a base of young and well trained journalists involved in the media in Moldova ICJ would like to give them mode st support to implement new ideas in the changing media environment.
